short_desc: Six-month to two year transitional housing program for homeless women who have income
description: INDEPENDENT HOUSE (IH) is a 10-room, short-term communal living, transitional housing program for women that are able to live independently and are motivated to take the necessary steps to move from homelessness into permanent housing. Rooms for women and families in the NCWC are designated for this six-month transitional housing program. IH serves women who demonstrate a relatively high degree of independence, but need time to further stabilize and prepare for the transition to permanent housing.TRANSITIONAL HOUSE (TH) includes living skills program for women with psychiatric disabilities leading to permanent supportive housing placement. Program helps homeless women with severe psychiatric disabilities (and/or dual diagnosis) to develop the necessary living skills to live independently.
